e4: Switching to a new unbiased policy aligns with ethical standards and regulatory expectations, reducing legal risks and fostering trust with investors. While some investors may initially be confused, clear communication will mitigate misunderstandings. Over time, transparency promotes confidence, attracting more ethical and informed investors, supporting sustainable company growth.
e5: An ethical reporting policy ensures transparency, accuracy, and fairness, providing a truthful representation of a company's financial situation. It should prevent misinformation and avoid selectively benefitting certain investors over others. Ethical policies should comply with legal standards and foster trust by communicating any changes clearly to all stakeholders, maintaining consistent and honest engagement.
e6: What specific steps will the management take to ensure effective communication of the policy change to all investors? How do they plan to evaluate the impact of this change on investor perception and company stock performance? Are there strategies to support retail investors during this transition?
